lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Economist Ian Harwood of Warburg Securities said Lawson's budget must strike a balance between tax cuts aimed at home consumption and lower public borrowing for attracting support from overseas investors.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The decision facing Lawson is how best to use that so-called "fiscal adjustement" to maximise the government's all-round popularity ahead of the next general election.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: They said a boost given to the economy by consumer spending has helped reduce the Public Sector Borrowing Requirement (PSBR) for financial 1986/87 from an originally targetted 7.1 billion stg, despite big rises in government spending.

lst.name: sentence
